intro: Origanum micranthum, commonly known as narrow-leaved marjoram, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to its pungent, spicy fragrance. Origanum micranthum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
